description: Primes p that have exactly three primitive roots that are not primitive roots mod p^2.
comments: If x is a primitive root mod prime p then either x is a primitive root mod p^2 or x has order p-1 mod p^2.
example: 284, 793 and 1054 are primitive roots mod 1103, but not mod 1103^2.
author: _Jud McCranie_, Mar 24 2001
